actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend to all unmarried individuals the full tax benefits of income splitting now enjoyed by married individuals filing joint returns, and to remove rate inequities for married persons where both are employed.
short_title: Individual Tax Return Equity Act of 1981

summary.text: Individual Tax Return Equity Act of 1981 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide identical income tax rates for single persons, heads of households, and married couples filing jointly or separately. Establishes the zero bracket amount at $3,400 for all individual taxpayers.

titles.title: Individual Tax Return Equity Act of 1981

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend to all unmarried individuals the full tax benefits of income splitting now enjoyed by married individuals filing joint returns, and to remove rate inequities for married persons where both are employed.
